View Source

x

  1. - dimension in module wk.chart

This dimension defined the horizontal axis of the chart

Directive Info

  • This directive executes at priority level 0.

Usage

  • as element: 
    <x
  [axis=""]
  [type=""]
  [exponent=""]
  [property=""]
  [layer-property=""]
  [range=""]
  [date-format=""]
  [domain=""]
  [domain-range=""]
  [label=""]
  [format=""]
  [reset=""]
  [tick-format=""]
  [ticks=""]
  [grid=""]
  [show-label=""]
  [axis-formatters=""]
  [legend=""]
  [values-legend=""]
  [legend-title=""]>
...
</x>

Arguments

Param Type Details
axis string

Define if a horizontal axis should be displayed Possible values:
type
(optional)
 scale

Defines the d3 scale applied to transform the input data to a dimensions display value. All d3 scales are supported, as well as wk-chart specific extensions described here. #TODO insert correct links

(default: layout specific - see layout docs)
exponent
(optional)
 number

This attribute is only evaluated with pow and log scale types - defines the exponent for the d3 pow and log scale #TODO insert correct links
property expression

the input data property (properties) used to compute this dimension. In case the charts supports a the data layer dimension this attribute can be a list of data properties. In this case the property field can be omitted, for non-layer dimension it is required.
layerProperty
(optional)
 expression

defines the container object for property in case the data is a hierachical structure. See (#todo define link) for more detail
range
(optional)
 expression

The scale types range attribute. For x and y scales the range is set to the pixel width and height of the drawing container, for category... scales the range is set to the scales color range
dateFormat
(optional)
 expression

applies to Time scale type only. Describes the date display format of the property field content. can be omitted if the field is already a javascript Date object, otherwise the format is used to transform the property values into a Javascript Date object.Date Format is described using d3's Time Format
domain
(optional)
 expression

the scale types domain property. Meaning and acceptable values for domain depend on teh scale type, thus please see (TODO: define link) for further explanation
domainRange
(optional)
 expression

Certain scale type and dimensions require a calculation of the data range to perform the correct mapping onto the scale output.domainRange defined the rule to be used to calculate this. Possible values are: min: [0 .. minimum data value] max: [0 .. maximum data value] extent: [minimum data value .. maximum data value] total: applies only layer dimensions, calculates as 0 .. maximum of the layer value totals]
label
(optional)
 expression

defined the dimensions label text. If not specified, the value of teh 'property' attribute is used
format
(optional)
 expression

a formatting string used to display tooltip and legend values for the dimension. if omitted, a default format will be applied please note tha this is different from the 'tickFormat' attribute
reset
(optional)
 expression

If sepcified or set to true, the domain values are reset every time the carts data changes.
tickFormat
(optional)
 expression
ticks
(optional)
 expression
grid
(optional)
 expression
showLabel
(optional)
 expression
axisFormatters
(optional)
 expression
legend
(optional)
 expression

(Accepted Values: true, false, top-right, top-left, bottom-left, bottom-right, #divName)

(default: true)
valuesLegend
(optional)
 expression
legendTitle
(optional)
 expression
